security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. Provides review frameworks and checklists using standard Claude Code tools (Read, Grep, Glob, Bash, Task). No network access, no file writes, no credential access, no code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Review code for quality, security, performance, and accessibility
content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides structured review checklists and automated analysis across multiple dimensions. Developers get consistent, comprehensive feedback on every change.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code changes using git diff commands
Check for security vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets)
Review performance patterns (N+1 queries, memoization, efficient algorithms)
Audit accessibility compliance (WCAG, ARIA, keyboard navigation)
Evaluate code quality (naming, structure, error handling, type safety)
Score reviews with A-F grading system and severity levels
limitations: Automated checks only - cannot replace human judgment for complex architectural decisions
Does not execute code or run tests - static analysis only
Context awareness depends on provided repository information
Language support varies by check type (TypeScript/JavaScript focused)

use_cases.title: Pre-commit self-review
use_cases.description: Review your own changes before committing to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Security-focused PR review
use_cases.description: Scan pull requests for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, credential leaks, and injection risks.

use_cases.title: Comprehensive code audit
use_cases.description: Evaluate code changes across quality, security, performance, and accessibility in a single review session.

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-security skill to check src/api/ for security issues. Look for SQL injection, XSS, and hardcoded credentials.

prompt_templates.title: Performance check
prompt_templates.scenario: Performance review for data processing code
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-performance skill to analyze src/utils/data-processing.ts. Focus on N+1 queries and memory usage.

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-accessibility skill to audit src/components/*.tsx. Check ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and semantic HTML.

prompt_templates.title: Full multi-dimensional review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the changes in this PR across all dimensions: quality, security, performance, and accessibility. Provide an overall score and prioritized improvement suggestions.

output_examples.input: Review my recent changes in src/services/user.ts for quality and security issues
output: - Medium: Line 45 - SQL injection risk in query construction
Recommendation: Use parameterized queries or ORM
- Low: Line 23 - Function exceeds 50 lines (67 lines detected)
- Low: Line 12 - Generic variable name 'data' should be more descriptive
1. Replace string concatenation with prepared statements

best_practices: Run reviews before committing to catch issues early and reduce review cycles
Use the quality gate to focus on the most relevant review dimension for your changes
Combine with linters (ESLint, TypeScript) for automated pre-review checks
anti_patterns: Skipping reviews for 'small' changes - many bugs hide in minor modifications
Ignoring low-severity issues - they accumulate and degrade code quality over time
Using reviews as punishment - frame them as learning opportunities for the team

faq.question: Which languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Primary focus is TypeScript/JavaScript. Security checks work on any language. Performance and quality checks are most effective with typed languages.

faq.question: Does this skill execute the code it reviews?
faq.answer: No, this is a static analysis tool. It reads code and runs read-only commands like git diff. It does not execute or modify any code.

faq.question: How accurate are the security vulnerability detections?
faq.answer: The skill identifies common patterns but may produce false positives. Always verify findings manually, especially for complex security issues.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: The skill provides review commands you can run in CI. It does not directly integrate but can be invoked as part of your pipeline scripts.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads files from your repository using Claude Code tools. No code or data is sent externally or stored permanently.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated tools like SonarQube?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered contextual review with explanations. It complements tools like SonarQube, which focus on specific metrics and rules.
